abstract: Editorial celebrates GlaxoSmithKline's new malaria vaccine, which reduces risk of infection in children by 47 percent and could save millions of lives in sub-Saharan Africa; notes there are several hurdles to surmount, including diminishing effectiveness of vaccine over time, and number of serious side effects.
snippet: A vaccine to protect children against malaria has shown promising results in a clinical trial. But there are big hurdles still to surmount.
lead_paragraph: A vaccine to protect children against malaria has shown promising results in a clinical trial. But there are big hurdles still to surmount.

headline.main: Two Cheers for the Malaria Vaccine
headline.print_headline: Two Cheers for the Malaria Vaccine
headline.seo: Two Cheers for the Malaria Vaccine
